revised_title: Optical Properties and Phenomena of Mother-of-Pearl and Their Communication to Other Substances
tldr: The author, David Brewster, investigates the unique optical properties of mother-of-pearl and how these properties can be transferred to other substances. He discovers that the peculiar phenomena of mother-of-pearl are due to a specific configuration of its surface, which consists of grooves that affect the axis of extraordinary reflection. Brewster also finds that the colors seen in mother-of-pearl depend on its thickness and that it polarizes light in a unique way compared to other crystallized bodies.
